divs: Sighting DetailsTonight was the first night of the Perseids meteor shower, so I was in my backyard to see if I could spot any. I was looking almost due north, toward Polaris, when I saw a flash of light close to the big dipper. I watched, because I thought I missed a meteor, and it flashed again. This was not airplane lighting (I live on the approach to XNA and see planes all the time). I've seen satellites go over before, and they're a constant light, not a flashing one. The flash was not fast, and the begining of the flash was slightly dimmer than the end of the flash. As I watched, it flashed five, or maybe six times, moving between the bottom star of the big dipper and Polaris in a straight line. The rate of the flash was maybe once every three to five seconds. I couldn't tell the speed of the object, as I couldn't tell the altitude. Then it stopped flashing. There were no clouds tonight. My feelings, reactions, and actions - Had to text my wife (she's at work). Don't know if it had anything at all to do with it, but about 5 minutes after I saw this, the neighborhood dogs started barking. Usually that doesn't happen unless there's an emergency vehicle siren, and there wasn't. I don't have video on my iPhone - sorry, wish I did because this would have been cool to catch.
Summary: Flashing object traveling west to east
trends: There has been one other sighting in Centerton
There were no other sightings in Centerton on or around July 17th 2009
